conversation.message:
Hi Student_E—thanks for reaching out, and we’re glad School_C is your first choice. In our admissions conversations, we look for (1) strong academic readiness and consistent effort, (2) positive contribution to the community (leadership, teamwork, service), and (3) clear fit—why our programs and culture match your goals.

If you’d like, share a brief note on your academic strengths, 1–2 activities you’re most proud of, and what specifically draws you to School_C. If School_C is truly your top choice, you’re also welcome to submit an application when ready—then we can make a formal decision.

What program/track or clubs at School_C are you most excited about, and what’s one example of how you’ve contributed to a team or community?
conversation.thought: Student_E is contacting with [TALK] and ranks School_C first, so they may apply soon. Since Student_E has not applied yet, I should respond with [TALK], encourage an application, and avoid any commitment while signaling what we value and asking for quick follow-up so we can decide if higher-priority candidates don’t materialize.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team—thank you again for considering my application earlier.

I noticed School_C still appears to have an open seat. I completely respect your prior decision, but I wanted to ask whether there is any possibility of reconsideration (or a waitlist-style review) if circumstances have changed. School_C remains my clear first choice, and I would enroll immediately if admitted.

If you are open to another look, I’m happy to provide any additional information you’d find helpful (recent grades, a short teacher note, or a more specific statement of fit with a particular program/club at School_C). Please let me know if there’s a specific item that would be most useful.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains available. It is my top true preference, but they already rejected my prior [APPLY]. Since I cannot apply elsewhere and want to maximize the chance of overturning the decision if their seat is still open, I will send a respectful [TALK] message asking whether reconsideration/waitlist is possible and offering any additional information that could change the outcome.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E—thank you for following up, and I appreciate how clear you’ve been that School_C remains your first choice.

At this time, our earlier decision hasn’t changed. We are still in an active stage of conversations and may need to reserve flexibility for other applicants under our process. That said, if our seat remains unfilled after the next rounds, we can revisit your file for a waitlist-style review.

If you’d like us to be able to reconsider quickly later, the most helpful add-on would be: (1) your most recent grades (or an updated progress report) and (2) a short note from a teacher confirming your consistency/impact in class. You’re also welcome to include a 3–5 sentence note naming one specific School_C program/club you’d join and what you would contribute in the first semester.

Please do continue engaging with other schools as well so you have strong options.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions Team,

Thank you for your earlier guidance. Since you mentioned a possible waitlist-style review if the seat remains unfilled, I wanted to share the quick add-ons you requested so you can reconsider efficiently if you’re able.

1) Updated grades/progress: My most recent progress report remains steady overall, with consistent completion of assignments and strong effort across subjects (no major drops; I’ve been proactive about extra practice when needed).

2) Teacher note (summary): My math teacher is willing to confirm that I’m consistently prepared, contribute constructively in class, and regularly support peers during group work by explaining steps and sharing organized notes.

3) Specific fit (program/club): I’m especially excited about joining a collaborative, service- or teamwork-oriented club at School_C (e.g., a community service or academic team setting). In my first semester, I would contribute by taking responsibility for planning/coordination tasks, keeping shared materials organized, and helping teammates stay on track so the group performs well.

School_C remains my clear first choice, and if admitted I would enroll immediately. If the seat is still open and you’re able to revisit my file now, I would be grateful for reconsideration.

Sincerely,
Student_E

At this moment, we’re still in an active stage of the process and need to keep flexibility for other candidates who may apply in the next rounds, so we are not ready to change our earlier decision yet.

If our seat remains unfilled after the next round or two, we will be able to revisit your file promptly using what you’ve provided. In the meantime, please continue pursuing other schools as well so you have strong options.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
